course.subject: SHSS
course.name: First-year Seminar
course.description: The seminar will focus on a topic or research area of special interest to a faculty member at SHSS. The faculty member will lead tutorial discussions, and inspire students to examine specific issues through fieldwork, projects and/or further reading. May be graded PP. For GCS students only.

reviews.author: qqqyo
reviews.title: introductory course of the school
reviews.comment_content:
聽8個talk咁嘅東西
介紹exchange，intern，自己school嘅課程等等

This two-semester course is designed to facilitate the transition of Global China Studies (GCS) students into university life. It helps and encourages students to become engaged members of the HKUST community. Sessions in the Fall semester provide introductions to the GCS program, overviews of academic/non-academic resources and support facilities, and discussions on exchange, internship, and career planning. In the Spring semester, students are introduced to the educational opportunities and resources provided by the School of Humanities and Social Science (SHSS) for the studies of humanities, social science, language and communication, and creative arts.
reviews.comment_teaching:

但都係Prof. Wong主持
reviews.comment_grading:
正常次次有返
寫文唔太hea正正常常咁
最後B+
reviews.comment_workload:
每次上堂最尾都要係canvas答一題簡單問題
寫長少少啦可以攞到4/4分

最後要寫一篇文，唔太長，好似得兩板
誠懇少少寫啦

• Attendance (15%) – Session 1 (1%); Sessions 2-8 (2% each)
• Participation (15%)
• Self-reflection essay (70%)

reviews.author: Loner
reviews.title: First-year seminars for GCS UG students
reviews.comment_content: This two-semester course is designed to facilitate the transition of Global China Studies (GCS) students into university life. It helps and encourages students to become engaged members of the HKUST community. Sessions in the Fall semester offer an introduction to the GCS program, overviews of academic/non-academic resources and support facilities, and discussions on exchange, internship, and career planning. In the Spring semester, students are introduced to the educational opportunities and resources provided by the School of Humanities and Social Science (SHSS) for the studies of humanities, social science, language and communication, and creative arts.
reviews.comment_teaching: Eight seminars were narrated by different lecturers, which were all hosted by James Wong. The seminars in the fall semester are more focusing on things like school life and career planning. In spring, there are four seminars which are about academy and study skills in SHSS. In general, it is a relaxing course for GCS freshmen.
reviews.comment_grading:
• Attendance and participation (20 points) – (2.5 points for each session)
• Ad hoc assignments (20 points) – (5 points for each assignment)
• Self-reflection essay (60 points)

Not very difficult to get satisfactory grades. I got an A in the end.
reviews.comment_workload: The ad hoc assignments require students to listen and participate in class but they are not difficult to finish. At the end of the spring semester, each student should write one self-reflection essay in about 750 words regarding sharing their attitude and brief outlook of their university life.

reviews.author: alexchw
reviews.comment_content:
Actually I think it is good to include different themes for every seminar and most of the seminars are quite interesting which is helpful for the studies.

This course is offered for GCS students. To be one of the GCS students, I think the course can increase our recognition to UST and also the course.

So I give an A for the content.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think James is enthusiastic for his teaching as he can control the atmosphere during lecture/seminar which can make the lesson smooth and relax. Besides, he always has good time managing skill.

A good teacher/ professor, so A for teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
15% Attendance
85% Self-reflection essay

Write a positive essay and be present in every seminar, the grade must be reasonable.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is so acceptable that it only includes taking attendance and the essay in about 500 words.

So it is no denying that I should give an A for the workload part.

reviews.author: Bella Dou
reviews.comment_content: Help you learn more about your major and career path etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teachers are friendly, and they really tell me in detail. You can ask questions if you do have any questions.
reviews.comment_grading: THE grade is not bad at all thus it is a one-credit the teacher is not that strict. Meanwhile, if you ask questions or participate in the discussion you can take a bonus point.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too bad since the only main assignment is a personal essay. And some projects but not too hard if you follow the instructions.

reviews.author: chimz
reviews.title: waste of time and resources
reviews.comment_content:
talks on career prospect, exchange programme, academic integrity...It's not a regular course teaching certain area of knowledge.

This is a full year course, not only one semester
reviews.comment_teaching: pretty boring, not helpful for my studies. I know my career prospect sucks, don't try to comfort people by saying fluffy words.
reviews.comment_grading: i have no idea why I get a "B".
reviews.comment_workload:
More than a 1 credit course supposed. Don't skip lessons. 8 classes throughout the whole year. The credit will only be counted in spring semester, not fall semester. So ignore this credit when you are registering courses for fall semester
